oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Exile - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Exile (musicial group). The episode was set to air for the week of October 10, 1988. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Exile
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Exile Pulsebeat show -- (00:34) It's You Again (Exile) -- (03:51) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (03:56) Dial 901 [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (05:05) Spangler reveals the Cuban influence of the Exiles; additionally, Sonny LeMaire reveals why the band changed from pop to country -- (07:01) The members of Exile discuss the difference of recording with Exile from Restless Heart -- (07:31) I Don't Want to be a Memory (Exile) -- (10:40) Spangler expresses the accolades of Paul Martin; additionally, the members of Exile reflect on Martin's welcome to the band -- (11:49) Shelter From the Night (Exile) -- (14:50) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (15:09) Spangler reveals the good-hearted nature of exile -- (15:30) Lee Carroll reflects on the decision to not limit oneself to one genre; additionally, Spangler and Exile discuss what was deliberate in their songwriting -- (18:11) Woke Up in Love (Exile) -- (20:52) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (21:12) Spangler asks Exile what song they wished to hear -- (21:49) Chiseled in Stone (Vern Gosdin) -- (25:25) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Exile (Musical group);
